title: There Is / There Isn't
objectives: Use 있다/없다 for existence and possession
Describe where things are with location words
context: 있다/없다 covers 'to have,' 'to be located,' and 'to exist.'
Combine with location markers to place objects and people.
These patterns appear everywhere: shops, directions, home descriptions.

vocabulary.english: to not exist / to not have

sentences.english: The cafe is in front of the station.
The bus stop is over there.
There is a cat at home.

explanation: 있다/없다 conjugate to 있어요/없어요 in polite present. With subjects, use 이/가: 화장실이 있어요? 아니요, 없어요.
For possession, Korean literally says 'Something exists (for me)': 저한테 시간 있어요 = I have time. 지갑이 없어요 = I don't have my wallet.
Location structure: [Place/Thing] + 이/가 + [Location word] + 에 있어요. Example: 은행이 시장 옆에 있어요.
여기/거기/저기 can replace a full place name when pointing. Add 에 to mark location: 거기에 있어요 = It's there.
없다 can sound abrupt alone; soften with 죄송하지만 or 미안해요 when refusing politely.
